Preparation of solutions for the experiment. Preparing Molybdate Solution

Transfer it into a flask containing 50 ml distilled water.
Transfer it into a flask containing 50 ml distilled water.
Mix thoroughly and label it as molydate solution.

Preparing Reducing Solution.
Weigh 11.25 g sodium hydrogen phosphate into the conical flask.
Take a glass rod from the beaker.
Stir the solution in the conical flask with the glass rod.
Dissolve it in 30 ml distilled water.
Using an electronic balance weigh 2.25 g sodium sulphate.
Using an electronic balance weigh 2.25 g sodium sulphate.
Take the butter paper with sodium sulphate from weighing balance.
Add it into the same conical flask.
Also add weighed 0.19 gm 1 amino 2 naphthol 4 sulphuric acid and dilute the mixture to 75 ml with water.
Also add weighed 0.19 gm 1 amino 2 naphthol 4 sulphuric acid and dilute the mixture to 75 ml with water.
Stir the mixture thoroughly.
Stir the mixture thoroughly.
Stir the mixture thoroughly.
Stir the mixture thoroughly.
Filter it into a clean conical flask.
Filter it into a clean conical flask.
Filter it into a clean conical flask.
Take a glass stopped dark bottle.
Transfer the reducing solution to the dark bottle.
Transfer the reducing solution to the dark bottle.
Transfer the reducing solution to the dark bottle.
Label it as reducing solution.
Label it as reducing solution.

Preparing Standard Solution Of Phosphate.
Add 20 mg potassium dihyrogen phosphate.
Dissolve it in 75ml distilled water.
Dissolve it in 75ml distilled water.

Label the solution.

Take 10 test tubes of 10 ml each.
Take the first test tube and label it as blank.
Take the first test tube and label it as blank.
Label the second test tube as 0.2 ml.
Label the second test tube as 0.2 ml.
Label the second test tube as 0.2 ml.
Similarly label the successive test tubes as 0.4 ml, 0.6 ml…………………to 1.8 ml.
Similarly label the successive test tubes as 0.4 ml, 0.6 ml…………………to 1.8 ml.
Take a micro pipette.
Adjust the micro pipette to 500 microliter.
Insert a fresh tip.
Pour 500 microliter molybdate solution to the test tube labeled as blank.
Pour 500 microliter molybdate solution to the test tube labeled as blank.
Pour the same volume of molybdate solution to the successive test tubes.
Pour the same volume of molybdate solution to the successive test tubes.
Discard the tip.
Adjust the micropipette to 200 microliter.
Insert a fresh pipette tip.
Pour 200 microlitre reducing solution to all test tubes.
Pour 200 microlitre reducing solution to all test tubes.
Pour 200 microlitre reducing solution to all test tubes.
Similarly add phosphate stock solution to the test tube labeled as 0.2 ml to 1.8 ml.
Recap the reducing solution.
Keep all tubes for 30 minutes to develop the color, Blue color is developed in all test tubes except blank.
